events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle at an intersection during rush hour, requesting immediate assistance.
The claim was reviewed and categorised as an 'Auto Accident' based on the description mentioning a car collision and damages.
A claims agent specializing in auto accidents was assigned to handle this case to ensure proper follow-up and processing.
The customer received official confirmation that their auto accident claim was acknowledged and is now under review.
The claims department requested copies of the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a repair estimate.
The customer promptly submitted all requested documents, including police reports and multiple photos of the damaged car.
The investigator began reviewing the submitted materials and contacted witnesses to verify the details of the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded confirming the other driver’s fault and validating the customer's damages claimed in the auto accident.
A fair settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs along with additional compensation for temporary transportation.
The customer provided positive feedback, expressing satisfaction with the timely updates and the settlement proposal received.
The claim was formally approved by the claims manager after all validations and customer agreement on the settlement terms.
The payment to cover the vehicle repairs and related expenses was processed and issued to the customer's designated account.
The auto accident claim was successfully closed following payment issuance and confirmation that the customer’s vehicle is being repaired.
All case documents and correspondence were archived for record-keeping and possible future reference regarding the auto accident claim.
